text: Yam Madar (; born December 21, 2000) is an Israeli professional basketball player for Hapoel Tel Aviv of the Israeli Premier League. Standing at , he plays at the point guard position. ==Early life== Madar was born in Beit Dagan, Israel, to a family of Mizrahi Jewish (Yemenite-Jewish) descent. He played for Maccabi Beit Dagan and Hapoel Tel Aviv youth teams. ==Professional career== ===Hapoel Tel Aviv (2018–present)=== On June 24, 2018, Madar signed a four-year deal with Hapoel Tel Aviv. On September 21, 2018, he made his debut in a FIBA Champions League qualifying round match against Spirou Charleroi, playing 15 minutes off the bench. On July 3, 2020, Madar recorded a career- high 28 points, shooting 11-of-17 from the field and 3-of 3 from the line in a 106-105 loss to Maccabi Ashdod.https://www.jpost.com/israel- news/sports/regular-season-finally-winds-down-635049 In the quarter-finals series vs league leaders, Maccabi Tel-Aviv, Madar was the leading scorer with 17.3 points while shooting 45% FG and 89% FT. He added 5.3 assists, 3.0 rebounds, and 2.0 steals, but despite his performance, Maccabi won 2-1.https://basket.co.il/player.asp?PlayerId=11214⟨=en. In Hapoel's only win on the series, he had 22 points, shooting 8-of-16 from the field and 5-of-5 from the line. He added 6 assists and 5 rebounds. On July 26 Madar was selected as the most improved player of the league.https://www.eurohoops.net/en/others/1084675/deni-avdija-named-winner- leagues-israeli-player-of-the-year/. Madar was the youngest player to ever win the most improved player title in the Israeli league. ==National team career== In July 2018, Madar participated at the 2018 FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship Division B with the Israeli Under-18 team, where he averaged 11.4 points, 3.3 rebounds, 3 assists and 1.8 steals per game. In July 2019, Madar won the 2019 FIBA Europe Under-20 Championship with the Israeli Under-20 team. Madar led the tournament in assists with 7.7 per game, along with 15.9 points, 3.1 rebounds and 1.4 steals for 19.6 PIR per game, earning a spot in the All- Tournament Team, alongside his teammate Deni Avdija. ==Personal life== His father, Zohar Madar, is a former mayor of Beit Dagan. ==References== == External links == * RealGM profile * FIBA profile Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:Hapoel Tel Aviv B.C. players Category:Israeli Jews Category:Israeli men's basketball players Category:Israeli people of Yemeni-Jewish descent Category:Mizrahi Jews Category:People from Central District (Israel) Category:Point guards
